Definition: A round fruit with red, yellow, or green skin and white flesh
A very young child or infant
A round object used in sports or games
A large, heavy mammal with thick fur and a short tail
A piece of furniture for sleeping or resting on
A hollow metal object that makes a ringing sound when struck
A warm-blooded egg-laying animal with feathers and wings
A vehicle that travels on water
A container with a flat base and sides, typically square or rectangular and having a lid
A male child or young man
A staple food made from flour, water, and yeast, baked into a loaf
A sweet baked food made from a mixture of flour, sugar, and other ingredients
A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an engine
A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur
A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs
A domestic fowl kept for its eggs or meat
An outer garment worn to protect against cold weather
A tall cereal plant that produces kernels on large ears
A fully grown female animal of a domesticated breed of ox, kept to produce milk or beef
A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout and an acute sense of smell
A small model of a human figure, typically used as a child's toy
A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle
A waterbird with a broad blunt bill, short legs, webbed feet, and a waddling gait
An oval or round object laid by a female bird, reptile, fish, or invertebrate
A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins living wholly in water
The seed-bearing part of a plant, consisting of reproductive organs surrounded by petals
A female child or young woman
The end part of a person's arm beyond the wrist, including the palm, fingers, and thumb
The upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal
A large plant-eating domesticated mammal with solid hoofs and a flowing mane and tail
A building for human habitation, especially one that is lived in by a family or small group of people
An adult human male
A white liquid produced by female mammals for feeding their young
A medium of exchange in the form of coins and banknotes
A woman in relation to her child or children
A structure or place made or chosen by a bird for laying eggs and sheltering its young
A material manufactured in thin sheets from the pulp of wood or other fibrous substances
A painting or drawing
An omnivorous domesticated hoofed mammal with sparse bristly hair and a flat snout
A small mammal with long ears, long hind legs, and a short fluffy tail
A small circular band, typically of precious metal and often set with gemstones, worn on a finger
A domesticated ruminant animal with a thick woolly coat and typically only the male having horns
A covering for the foot, typically made of leather, having a sturdy sole and not reaching above the ankle
A small, nimble tree-dwelling rodent with a bushy tail
A thin piece of wood that has fallen or been cut from a tree
The star around which the earth orbits
A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a level surface
An object for a child to play with, typically a model or miniature replica of something
A woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk growing to a considerable height
A small timepiece worn typically on the wrist
An opening in the wall or roof of a building or vehicle that is fitted with glass to admit light or air
The hard fibrous material that forms the main substance of the trunk or branches of a tree or shrub
A flattened structure of a higher plant, typically green and blade-like
A hardy domesticated ruminant animal that has backward curving horns and is kept for milk and meat
The natural satellite of the earth, visible by reflected light from the sun
A large, heavy motor vehicle used for transporting goods, materials, or troops
A flying mammal with a mouselike body and membranous wings
A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side
A mechanical or electrical device for measuring time, indicating hours, minutes, and sometimes seconds
A device for giving light, either one consisting of an electric bulb together with its holder and shade or cover
A sturdy item of footwear covering the foot and ankle, and sometimes also the lower leg
A device used to transmit sound over a distance using wire or radio, especially a telephone
A portable shelter made of cloth, supported by one or more poles and stretched tight by cords or loops attached to pegs
The organ of hearing and balance in humans and other vertebrates
The part projecting above the mouth on the face of a person or animal, containing the nostrils and used for breathing and smelling
The organ of sight in humans and other animals
A tailless amphibian with a short squat body, moist smooth skin, and very long hind legs for leaping
A fixed luminous point in the night sky which is a large, remote incandescent body like the sun
A small rodent that typically has a pointed snout, relatively large ears and eyes, and a long tail
A light frame covered with thin material, flown in the wind at the end of a long string
A garment for the foot and lower part of the leg, typically knitted from wool, cotton, or nylon, and in pairs.
A small piece of shaped metal with incisions cut to fit the wards of a particular lock, which is inserted into a lock and turned to open or close it
A bicycle or motorcycle
A small carnivorous mammal with a pointed muzzle and bushy tail, proverbial for its cunning
A yellowish- or brownish-green edible fruit that is typically narrow at the stalk and wider toward the base
A musical instrument sounded by being struck with sticks or the hands, typically cylindrical, barrel-shaped, or bowl-shaped
A small open container for drinking from, typically having a handle
A flying insect that collects nectar and pollen, produces wax and honey, and lives in large communities
A covering for the head worn for warmth, as a fashion item, or as part of a uniform
Spun thread used for knitting, weaving, or sewing
A round juicy citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind
